definitions: To cause surprise or confusion in (someone), especially by acting against their expectations.
To prove (a theory, expectation, or prediction) wrong.
To defeat (a plan, aim, or hope).
To mix up (something) with something else so that the individual elements become difficult to distinguish.
examples: The intricate puzzle will confound even the most experienced solvers.
His calm demeanor confounded her expectations.
The sudden rain confounded their plans for a picnic.
She often confounds the twins, mistaking one for the other.
